title: Patrick Kohlmann
text:
Patrick Kohlmann (born 25 February 1983) is a German-Irish former professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and current assistant coach at <a href="Holstein%20Kiel">Holstein Kiel</a>. A <a href="Borussia%20Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a> youth exponent, he played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> for <a href="Holstein%20Kiel">Holstein Kiel</a>, <a href="1.%20FC%20Union%20Berlin">1. FC Union Berlin</a>, <a href="FC%20Rot-Wei%C3%9F%20Erfurt">Rot-Weiß Erfurt</a>, and <a href="Borussia%20Dortmund%20II">Borussia Dortmund II</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Dortmund">Dortmund</a> to a German father and Irish mother, Kohlmann began his football career with BV Westfalia Wickede, before moving on to <a href="TSC%20Eintracht%20Dortmund">TSC Eintracht Dortmund</a>. In 1993, he impressed <a href="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> club <a href="Borussia%20Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a> and signed for their youth team.
Kohlmann stayed at Borussia Dortmund for 14 years, where he elevated from youth player to playing for the <a href="Borussia%20Dortmund%20II">reserves</a>. His chances with the first team were limited, often as an unused sub. He finally got his chance in 2004 versus <a href="1.%20FC%20Kaiserslautern">1. FC Kaiserslautern</a> but went off with a bad knee injury. It was to be his only season as a first team squad member. For the reserve team, he made 101 Regionalliga appearances with 2 goals.
In 2007, Kohlmann signed for <a href="Regionalliga%20Nord">Regionalliga Nord</a> side <a href="Rot-Wei%C3%9F%20Erfurt">Rot-Weiß Erfurt</a> and helped in their push for promotion to the <a href="3.%20Liga">3. Liga</a>.
The next season, he joined fellow 3. Liga side <a href="1.%20FC%20Union%20Berlin">1. FC Union Berlin</a>. Until his departure in 2014, he amassed 142 <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> appearances scoring 2 goals.
Kohlmann signed for <a href="Holstein%20Kiel">Holstein Kiel</a> in July 2014. After 74 3. Liga caps for Holstein Kiel, he retired at the end of the 2016–17 season and became assistant coach at the club.
International career.
Kohlmann represented the <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Republic of Ireland U21 national team</a> five times. He made his debut on 19 August 2003, against <a href="Poland%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Poland</a>. He was also in the squad of Irish U-20 in 2000. Kohlmann was eligible to represent Ireland because of his Irish mother.
